title: Prevent and Treat Shock
brief: Position and care for injured persons to prevent shock and maintain circulation.
steps: Step 1: If victim is conscious, place on level surface with legs elevated 15-20 centimeters.
Step 2: If unconscious, place on side or abdomen with head turned to prevent choking.
Step 3: If unsure of best position, place victim perfectly flat and do not move.
Step 4: Remove all wet clothing immediately and replace with dry clothing.
Step 5: Maintain body heat by insulating from ground and surroundings.
Step 6: Provide external warmth: warm liquids, prewarmed sleeping bag, another person's body heat.
Step 7: Use warmed water in canteens, hot rocks wrapped in clothing, or fires on both sides.
Step 8: If conscious, slowly give small doses of warm salt or sugar solution.
Step 9: If unconscious or has abdominal wounds, give no fluids by mouth.
Step 10: Have victim rest for at least 24 hours.
warnings: Never give oral fluids to unconscious victims or those with abdominal wounds.
Too much pressure on neck pressure points can cause unconsciousness or death.
Once positioned for shock, do not move the victim.
